unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of households to high-speed internet. The expansion is particularly focused on Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, addressing the digital divide and boosting economic growth.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of households to high-speed internet. The expansion is particularly focused on Tier two and Tier three cities, addressing the digital divide and boosting economic growth.

unnormalised: A recent report from TRAI indicates a surge in FTTH subscriptions, projecting a doubling of connections by 2025. JioFiber, for example, plans to cover an additional 100,000 km of fiber optic cable by the end of the fiscal year. Airtel Xstream Fiber is focusing on customized plans catering to diverse user needs, including bundled OTT subscriptions.
normalised: A recent report from T R A I indicates a surge in F T T H subscriptions, projecting a doubling of connections by two thousand and twenty five. JioFiber, for example, plans to cover an additional one hundred thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable by the end of the fiscal year. Airtel Xstream Fiber is focusing on customized plans catering to diverse user needs, including bundled O T T subscriptions.

unnormalised: Speaking at the India Mobile Congress at 11:00 hrs on 25/10/2023, Telecom Secretary K. Rajaraman reiterated the government’s commitment to supporting FTTH deployment through policy initiatives and infrastructure sharing. The government aims to achieve universal broadband access by 15/08/2027, coinciding with the 80th anniversary of India's independence. Analysts estimate that these aggressive FTTH rollouts are expected to contribute Rs. 25,000 crore to the Indian economy by 31/03/2024.
normalised: Speaking at the India Mobile Congress at eleven zero zero hours on twenty fifth October two thousand and twenty three, Telecom Secretary K. Rajaraman reiterated the government’s commitment to supporting F T T H deployment through policy initiatives and infrastructure sharing. The government aims to achieve universal broadband access by fifteenth August two thousand and twenty seven, coinciding with the eightieth anniversary of India's independence. Analysts estimate that these aggressive F T T H rollouts are expected to contribute rupee twenty five thousand crore to the Indian economy by thirty first March two thousand and twenty four.
